biography.value:
Simon Aumar suffers under the weight of his family name. Though he is a descendent of an elf and the legendary wizard Elminster Aumar, Simon’s own sorcerous wild magic runs uncontrolled through his veins. Simon has not yet developed the ability to harness his power, and his spells explode or fizzle seemingly at random.

Though he’s dogged by doubt, the brave young mage has earned his place in Edgin Darvis;Edgin’s crew. He performs best under pressure, instinctively unleashing his magic in dire moments. How he will continue to unlock his potential and what he will do with his volatile gift are yet to be seen.

description.value:
Simon makes three Quarterstaff or Chaos Bolt attacks. He can replace one attack with one use of Spellcasting.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 − 1) &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage, or 3 (1d8 − 1) &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage if used with two hands, plus [[/damage 2d10 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod average=true]] damage of a random type determined by rolling a d8: 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, force; 5, lightning; 6, poison; 7, psychic; 8, &Reference[thunder]{thunder}.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

Roll a d6. On a roll of 1, Simon must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table in the Player’s Handbook. On a roll of 2 or higher, Simon casts one of the following spells, using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

At will: mage hand, minor &Reference[ill]{illusion}, prestidigitation, speak with dead (Simon must be holding his deathly token to cast this spell)

2/day each: fog cloud, mage armor, magic missile, spider climb

1/day each: Bigby’s hand, major image

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

&Reference[fey]{Fey} Ancestry. Simon has advantage on saving throws he makes to avoid or end the &Reference[charmed]{charmed} condition on himself, and magic can’t put him to sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Special Equipment. Simon carries a bag of holding, two pairs of sending stones, and a deathly token (see Spellcasting).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Wild Magic. When Simon takes 20 or more damage from a single source or takes damage from a critical hit, he must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table in the Player’s Handbook.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

When Simon or another creature he can see within 10 feet of himself would take damage, he conjures a shimmering, 10-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of magical &Reference[force]{force} centered on himself. Creatures inside the &Reference[sphere]{sphere} have resistance to the damage that triggered this reaction.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The &Reference[ill]{illusion} also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} becomes faint to the creature.

This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving &Reference[material]{material} for 1 hour.
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.


If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Special Notes: Simon must be holding his deathly token to cast this spell.

You grant the semblance of life and &Reference[int]{intelligence} to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer the questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be &Reference[undead]{undead}. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are hostile to it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

items.name: Speak with Dead (Simon must be holding his deathly token to cast this spell)

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical &Reference[force]{force} surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

You create three glowing darts of magical &Reference[force]{force}. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 &Reference[force]{force} damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot level above 1st.

Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving its hands free. The target also gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed.

materials.value: a drop of bitumen and a spider

description.value:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or &Reference[cold]{cold} to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature (like a troglodyte's stench).

As long as you are within range of the &Reference[ill]{illusion}, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the &Reference[ill]{illusion} to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your &Reference[concentration]{concentration}.

atwill: speak with dead (Simon must be holding his deathly token to cast this spell)

edgeCases.name: speak with dead
edgeCases.edge: Simon must be holding his deathly token to cast this spell
